content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
Use-case: Primary smelting station for converting raw materials into iron plates; supports the production of additional iron plates for factory operations.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5)  
Use-case: Extraction and initial transport of iron ore for further processing.

### Copper Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)  
Use-case: Processes copper ore into copper plates for advanced manufacturing.

### Lab Power Integration System at (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5)  
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)  
– Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5)  
– Boiler at (–4.0, 20.5) with orientation RIGHT  
– Fallback Boiler at (–2.0, 26.5) placed using the fallback nearest_buildable method  
– New Boiler at (–13.5, 22.0) placed via adjusted buildable center attempts  
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) (currently producing no power)  
Use-case: Supports laboratory operations with interconnected power and fluid systems.

### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 6.5)
Consists of:
– Repositioned Assembling Machine at (2.5, 6.5) configured for the Copper Cable recipe (status: NO_POWER)  
– Pre-existing Small Electric Pole at (4.5, 6.5) serving as a local power node  
– Stone Furnace at (7.0, 11.0) for smelting Copper Ore into Copper Plates  
– Additional Small Electric Pole at (2.5, 3.5) placed using direction UP (spacing 1)  
– Additional Small Electric Pole at (2.5, 8.5) placed using direction DOWN (spacing 0)  
– Intermediate Small Electric Pole at (8.5, 18.5) manually placed to bridge the connection between the Steam Engine and the Assembling Machine  
– Fallback Small Electric Pole at (0.5, 6.5) placed adjacent to the Assembling Machine  
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) connected via multiple chain attempts (currently producing no power)  
Use-case: Produces Copper Cables from smelted Copper Plates; persistent power and connectivity challenges remain.

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– Multiple pre-established PipeGroups spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5) and additional groups at (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (–9.5, 24.5), (2.5, 9.5), (10.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 25.5)  
– Recent adjustments attempted to directly connect an Offshore Pump to a new Boiler, though fluid flow remains interrupted.  
Use-case: Transports fluids between production components; unresolved connectivity issues impede water flow and steam generation.

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting inserter and belt outputs  
– Electricity network via multiple ElectricityGroups with poles at positions such as [(–10.5, –49.5), (–12.5, –48.5), (–12.5, –50.5)], near (3.5, 0.5), [(6.5, 3.5), (5.5, 8.5)] and [(2.5, 30.5), (7.5, 26.5)]  
Use-case: Provides overall material handling and supports factory operations with an extensive power network.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Direct Pipe Connection Issues  
 – Verify that the fluid connection points of both the Offshore Pump and the Boiler are aligned and unobstructed.  
 – Adjust placement offsets to ensure target connections are within a valid range.

• Entity Placement Distance Violations  
 – Move closer to the target area to remain within the allowed build distance.  
 – Confirm current coordinates relative to target tiles before attempting placement.

• Entity Placement Collision and Overlap  
 – Ensure target tiles are free from existing entities and environmental obstructions.  
 – Reassess spacing and directional parameters when collisions are detected.

• Boiler Placement Adjacent to Offshore Pump  
 – Validate that the intended boiler placement zones near the Offshore Pump allow correct pipe connections.  
 – Adjust directional offsets to avoid interference with existing fluid networks.

• Fallback Placement and Pipe Connection  
 – Ensure fallback or nearest_buildable placements are sufficiently close to establish required connectivity.  
 – Reevaluate buildable centers if initial placements result in connection failures.

• Boiler Crafting Resource Shortage  
 – Confirm that all requisite raw materials are available before initiating boiler production.  
 – Verify inventory and recipe requirements to avoid crafting interruptions.

• Repositioning and Buildable Area Failures  
 – Ensure candidate buildable areas are free from obstructions such as water or uneven terrain.  
 – Recalculate candidate coordinates if the initial selection proves invalid.

• Manual Placement Candidate Failures  
 – Survey candidate locations thoroughly and clear obstructions prior to reattempting manual placements.  
 – Address multiple candidate failures by verifying can_place_entity conditions across each location.

• Technology and Crafting Prerequisite Errors  
 – Complete required research (e.g., Landfill technology and logistic-science-pack prerequisites) before initiating advanced crafting.  
 – Verify production dependencies, ensuring proper furnace operation for sub-ingredient production.

• Inventory Capacity Errors  
 – Monitor and manage inventory capacity before performing insertion operations to avoid blockages.

• Inventory Resource Shortage  
 – Verify that essential items—such as coal—are available in the inventory before attempting insertions.  
 – Check resource counts to prevent errors like “No coal to insert” from occurring.

• Automation Science Pack Crafting Sub-Ingredient Shortages  
 – Ensure sufficient production of intermediate items (e.g., iron-gear-wheels) by maintaining an adequate supply of iron plates.  
 – Optimize smelting operations and scheduling in furnaces to sustain the production chain.  
 – Review and adjust the production chain to guarantee that crafting machines or furnaces can meet the sub-ingredient demands.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• def distance(pos1: Position, pos2: Position) -> float  
 – Computes the Euclidean distance between two positions.  
  • Success: Returns the computed distance when dependencies are properly imported.  
  • Failure: Raises NameError if required modules (e.g., math) are missing.

• def construct_pipe_chain(source: Position, target: Position, threshold: float, max_chain_segments: int) -> bool  
 – Attempts to build a pipe chain between the source and target using a nearest-buildable strategy.  
  • Success: Returns True upon establishing a valid connection.  
  • Failure: Returns False if construction fails due to obstructions or insufficient buildable areas.

Important Variables:
 – final_inventory: Dict[str, int] – Represents the current state of the agent’s inventory.
